critique: The document is a revocation of a previous executive order and a re-opening of public lands for homesteading, initially prioritizing ex-service men. The tone is formal and legalistic. The primary emotion the President likely wants to elicit is joy from ex-service men who will have priority in claiming land. There might be a slight element of surprise for those who didn't expect the lands to be re-opened. There's likely no intention to elicit sadness, anger, fear, or disgust.
